intro: Senna skinneri, commonly known as the slender senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces bright yellow flowers during the warmer months. Senna skinneri is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
